text.author: Associated Press; Guardian staff reporter
text.description: Veronica Lario decided to divorce Italian PM after he failed to tell her he would attend model's birthday party, says book
text.title: 'Lies' made me file for divorce, says Silvio Berlusconi's estranged wife

main.p: The estranged wife of the Italian prime minister, Silvio Berlusconi, has claimed his alleged lies pushed her to file for divorce as he became embroiled in a sex scandal.

In the book, Tendenza Veronica, (Veronica's Trend) – published today – Veronica Lario describes how she made the decision in April after Berlusconi failed to mention that he would attend a Naples birthday party for an 18-year-old model.
His attendance at Noemi Letizia's party was later reported in the media, sparking a series of allegations over his purported fondness for young women.
Berlusconi has denied having any improper relationship with Letizia or any other women.
The book published today is a revised edition of one first published in 2004 by the journalist Maria Latella.
In the new edition, she quotes 53-year-old Lario as saying the Naples incident was the latest problem in her relationship with her husband.
"It was the latest lie," Lario said. "Better, then, to try to seek a last way to respect myself – better to divorce. He put me in this situation."
Lario, a former actor with whom Berlusconi has three children, said his actions were embarrassing him on a global level.
"I cannot be his babysitter, and I cannot stop him any more from making himself ridiculous in front of the world," she said. "I'm done."
Lario's lawyer was not available for comment.

Lario caused a political storm when she announced her decision to divorce. Both the Italian and international media have since competed for new allegations linking the 72-year-old Berlusconi to models and even a prostitute.
Berlusconi has denied ever paying a woman for sex, and has dismissed the allegations as lies fabricated by the opposition and "left-leaning" media.
He has maintained his popularity in Italy despite the scandal and the centre-right coalition which won elections last year has remained stable.
